intro: Urostigma paraense, commonly known as the Paraense Urn Plant, is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features include alternate leaves with a distinctive shape and a flowering period that occurs during the wet season.
